strong: Type: Full Time with our client

li: Significant experience with SQL, Excel, and other data tools
li.1: Experience with Pyton/R and SAS (preferably both)
li.2: Experience collecting, combining, and interpreting data from multiple sources
li.3: Experience with version control (git, enterprise github)
li.5: Knowledge of data gathering, cleaning, and transforming techniques
li.6: Mathematical and statistical skills are also valuable to analyze data
li.7: Writing: Expect to produce written reports of recommendations
li.8: Prepare reports to communicate the results back to the relevant members of the business using the tools above and other as needed
li.9: Create appropriate documentation that allows stakeholders to understand

li: Problem-solving and critical thinking: These abilities are necessary to identify problems and then evaluate alternative solutions to determine which one is best.
li.1: Communication: Excellent listening skills allow analysts to understand clients' or colleagues' needs. Strong verbal communication skills make it easier to convey information effectively.
li.2: Reading comprehension: Computer systems analysts must read manuals and technical reports to keep up with advances and implement new technology that meets employers=E2=80=99 or clients=E2=80=99 needs.
li.3: Analytical skills: The ability to analyze large amounts of data quickly and efficiently is necessary.
li.4: Creativity: Think strategically about the information that will help stakeholders make business decisions
li.5: Ability to set and meet deadlines
li.6: Ability to work in high-pressure situations

li: Experience with data visualization software such as Tableau or Qlik
li.1: Experience with open-source rendering engines for markdown to modern documentation workflows like Jekyll, MkDocs or Docisfy)
li.2: Experience with open-source reporting and charting software like Plotly/Dash
